Hospital Name: Centre for Sight Eye Hospital, Juhu Vile Parle
Team And Speciality:
The Centre for Sight Eye Hospital, Juhu Vile Parle is a leading eye-care hospital for LASIK surgery, SMILE eye surgery, oculoplasty, ocular oncology surgeries. One of the advanced treatments it offers is, the blade-free Lasik (Femto Lasik) that uses the latest femtosecond laser technology, which is an advanced technique over the microkeratome. This technique creates a more precise and uniform corneal flap, enabling a safer and more precise vision correction procedure.
It also treats computer vision syndrome, all kinds of refractive errors such as myopia, hyperopia, astigmatism and presbyopia. Some of the other conditions it treats are, advanced retina services, cornea, glaucoma, paediatric squint, ocular surface & dry eye disorders, neuro ophthalmology, squint treatments in adults, retinoblastoma, keratoconous and low vision.
The Centre for Sight Eye Hospital, Juhu Vile Parle has an excellent team comprising some of the best Lasik and refractive surgeons who accurately diagnose the conditions and deliver excellent clinical outcomes. The success rates of the surgeons at the centre are commendable.

Team And Speciality:
The ten hospitals situated all over Berlin deliver top-quality and cutting edge medical care.
Vivantes treats over half a million patients each year in over 40 highly-specialized centers of excellence including the Aeromedical Center, Breast Center, Cancer Centers, Cardiac Rhythm Center, Cochlear Implant Center, Conservative Treatment of Liver Diseases and TumorsCraniocerebral Injury – Rehabilitation, Endoprosthetic Center, Geriatric Psychiatry Center, etc.

Infrastructure: The Vivantes Hospital Group is Germany’s largest state-owned group of hospitals with a total capacity of some 5,600 beds and more than 15,000 employees, 1,500 of whom are doctors.

Vivantes operates six specially equipped “Comfort Hospitals” in Berlin, each providing first-class medical care along with comfortable accommodation and facilities such as restaurants, lounges, wifi, and daily international newspapers, magazines, and TV.
It runs an international department, Vivantes International Medicine, to coordinate the medical tourism for which Berlin is one of the popular destinations.
Location:
The Vivantes Hospital Group consists of 10 hospitals, which are located in different parts of Berlin. Some of the most popular amongst them are listed below: 
Vivantes Humboldt-Klinikum
Vivantes Humboldt-Klinikum is situated in the north of Berlin and has over eleven specialist departments, more than 600 beds, and a Comfort Ward with extensive gardens. Roughly 65,000 patients are treated by 250 doctors here every year.
It is at a distance of 7.4 km via Berlin, Berlin-Tegel Airport. The drive takes about 15 minutes. The closest subway station is U-Bhf Rathaus Reinickendorf and the bus stop is Humboldt-Klinikum.
Vivantes Klinikum Am Urban
Vivantes Klinikum Am Urban is one of Berlin’s oldest hospitals and today offers first-class and state-of-the-art medicine. 56,000 patients are treated each year in the hospitals more than twelve specialist departments with almost 600 beds. 
It is at a distance of 13.8 km via Berlin, Berlin-Tegel Airport. The drive takes about 36 minutes. The closest subway station is U Südstern and the bus stop is Klinikum Am Urban (Berlin).
Vivantes Klinikum im Friedrichshain
Vivantes Klinikum im Friedrichshain is situated in the center of Berlin. With over 900 beds in 21 specialist departments, around 110,000 patients are treated here every year. 
It is at a distance of 15 km via Berlin, Berlin-Tegel Airport. The drive takes about 40 minutes. The closest subway station is Strausberger Platz and the tram stop is Klinikum im Friedrichshain (Berlin).
Vivantes Auguste-Viktoria-Klinikum
Vivantes Auguste-Viktoria-Klinikum is situated in Berlin’s south and offers more than 600 beds with more than 150 specialist departments and over 40 highly specialized centers of excellence in different disciplines.
It is at a distance of 14.4 km via Berlin, Berlin-Tegel Airport. The drive takes about 24 minutes. The closest subway station is Priesterweg.
Taxis and shuttles are easily available from the airport to the hospitals.
All the hospitals are close to numerous intriguing attractions filled with several restaurants and shopping centers.
